One thing I love about Yowamushi Pedal is that you don't have to be a fan of sports, sports anime or cycling to fall in love with the anime. The characters are all interesting and you grow to love them and hate them in your own kind of way. 
I find this anime funny, fun to watch, interesting and awesome. It's one of those anime's that'll keep you on edge during the races and give you feels when you see one of your beloved characters win or lose. If any of you guys like Kuroko No Basket then you will deffo love Yowamushi Pedal, Iwasn't sure at first as i'm not a big fan of cycling but trust me I absolutely loved it and now it's one of my favorite animes that i'll happily watch again ^^ until the new season comes out.\n\n
Honestly it's worth giving it a watch, i'd say give at least 4-5 episodes a shot and see what you think :) but you'll be missing out! it's cycling in a completely different way, it's fun and cool for a start! So cool that I'm planning on cosplaying Imaizumi and Manami from it! Don't just take my word tho! Get going and check out Yowamushi Pedal episode 1!!

Yowamushi Pedal is just your regular sports anime. As this is my first time trying to review an anime, I am just going to give it my honest opinion on it. As someone who is a fan of sports anime's in general, I find that Yowamushi Pedal is probably the best bicycle racing anime. But that doesn't mean that it was amazing. Anyways lets jump right on in (Warning, Minor Spoilers)
Story: 7
I actually thought the story was very original in some unique aspects. Even though it is your classic talented individual (Sakamichi) who never recognized he had a talent for bicycle racing, I thought thatthe beginning was a very good refresher. I also enjoyed the development of his skill. He was already pretty good to begin with and the training throughout the series made him into a pretty decent racer. The only thing that I did not like about the story and the episode structure is that some parts that only consisted of like 200m for example took around like 15 minutes. I found that to be quite annoying at times, perhaps because I wanted that scene to finish and get rolling on the next action scene, or I was just simply impatient/frustrated.


Art and Sound: 7

I think that this is just a regular anime when it comes to Art and Sound. There is nothing special about it. Like I said in the beginning, I find it to be your classic sports anime. I didn't think that there was anything that stood out (either very good or bad). 


Character and Enjoyment: 8/6

 I found that the characters seemed to be pretty cool except for a couple. One that had seemed really underdeveloped throughout the series was Makishima. I thought that since he was the climber that worked with Sakamichi, I thought they would go way more in depth into him than any other character. Turns out that wasn't really the case and we saw all of the upperclassmen have flashbacks of their own. My enjoyment factor was a 6 because of the scenes that sometimes took 15 minutes for like 4 seconds in the actual race. Even though they were intense, I just found these episodes to kind of be a waste of time. 


Overall and Conclusion: 7

I would honestly recommend this anime to anyone who is interesting in learning about bicycle racing and the sports genre in general. I think that it brings something new to the table since there aren't that many bicycle anime's anyways. Any time that I watch one of these sports anime's I always get a drive to be active and be fit as I am a runner myself. 


Final Quote: "Victory won't just fall in your lap. It's something I've learned through my victories and losses" - Tadokoro Jin

By episode 25, I have to say I've dropped this show for good. It's just a waste of time. This could be an entertaining show if you're a noob in anime. But for those who've watched anime for like, 10 years and more, this was just a rehashed of the elements of shounen-types with all its stereotypes.
I watched this because I just got myself into the venture of cycling. And I did my research and could tell the hybrids, MTBs, and road bikes apart; and cyclocross, and touring, and brands like Specialized, Giant, Trek, Cannondale, Cube, KTM, Boardman, and more.
What you get here is thesame vibe when watching Initial-D, Prince of Tennis, then character stereotypes found in Slam Dunk, and add some slight yakitate!Japan-type of humor in the mix, for a theme of cycling, and that's it for Yowamushi Pedal. The story is predictable and mediocre, you'll get a weak but not epic protagonist. Gurren Lagann already smashed the "weak protagonist" with Simoun, and thus no other anime might come as good, not until two decades or so.


Art is okay, I'm not mindful about the art, whether it's as fluid as KyoAni's, or intricate as CLAMP's; or quirky as PingPong; or epic as Kill la Kill or Gurren Lagann; as long as the story is befitting to waste time, art would be the last thing on my mind.


Sound is alright.


Again, for the characterization, you'll have a weak character for a protagonist, a quite arrogant second-placer deuteragonist, then some bishoujos on the sides reminiscent of Initial-D or other shounen anime (Saiki-K maybe? But that anime's epic, and this one isn't) ; some dude that reminded me of another dude in Akame ga Kill, in fact, the cast here kinda reminded me of Akame Ga Kill, and I last watched that show in 2016. It's all a set of varied, BUT predictable characters at best. So what charactrerization you've seen here, I'm sure you've seen them elsewhere.



Enjoyment... right. I was thinking it'd be like Initial-D on bikes, like I get to know what Specialized is and all that, but it is none of that. I should have just watched ESPN, or Long Riders if I was aiming to get the fancy delivery of bicycles and its parts and those.

Still, you still get those flashbacks as the action was about to progress, and some backstories that we've seen on other anime. But well, can't help it. At most, this is a generic, rehashed elements molded into a different story of road-cycling. 

Only SAO and its cousins (like Rei-Zero) are the type of anime I'd hate more; and this is me who's a fan of Gen Urobuchi-type of anime (Fate/Zero, Puella Magi, Psycho Pass, those kinda).


OVERALL, well, you watch this and be entertained and love this because you're a noob on the realm of anime. 

Maybe you still haven't watched DeathNote and would freak out once you've seen it---like it's the best anime evur; then you'd have a high-blood pressure and atrial fibrillation when you watch Attack on Titan, and get a brain aneurysm when you watched Psycho Pass.


But if you've watched the type of anime where more than half of them are NOT mainstream, then you can waste your life on something else, like go have a real cycling around town. 


Get a bicycle of your preference (hybrid, MTB, road, BMX) Specialized, or Giant, or Trek---you'll never be wrong with any of these three brands. :) Cube, Whyte, and Orbea are also great enough. Scott, and Marin are like... on the third-tier.


Get a reliable cycling helmet--- Kask, Giro, or Specialized;


then get a strong, robust bike-lock: Kryptonite, or Abus brands if you still want to find your bicycle where you left it off (and lock it properly and correctly, no bike-lock is infallible to a dimwitted owner). 


And that's it, you go cycling instead than watch this crap.

Let me tell you one thing, I watched this whole series while biking, in about 3 days. I can't even describe how much it helped me bike faster and for a longer amount of time. If you have a static bike or a base for it, I strongly recommend watching this anime.
The story itself is very inspiring at first, even though they make it seem like people with "mom bikes" are aliens. After the 7th or so episode, we stop seeing significant character evolution but it's still kind of good.
I really hated how the focus goes from a critical point for the main character tosomeone else and we don't get to see what happened to the main for 2 whole episodes. That purely depends on you but I wanted the main character to be under the spotlight more. \n\n
I was surprised by how they would talk about details only people who really like to bike know and they just forgot about basic physics. For example, I have never, not even once, seen a person biking and looking where they're supposed to. They will either have their eyes closed, look at the bikers next to or behind them... a whole mess overall. Also, there's a guy that rides the bike like he's a windscreen wiper... for some reason. \n\n
Overall, the anime is very funny and very inspiring, however, I feel like many people will find it very boring. If you do, bike while watching it. Trust me on this.

It's not the best anime, I know, but it has made me feel so much during the 2014, that's why Yowamushi Pedal it's one of my favorite animes.
It introduce us a history where an otaku guy,Onoda Sakamichi it's his first year in high school. As it's a new school he wants to make friends with common interests but instead of achieving that he joins the cycling club.
What I like so much about this anime is how it can make us have interest about what's going on and it's not a predictable shit like Kuroko no Basket where we see the Seirin Team always winning. Herewe see a main team who has trained but doesn't always win in the competetions that were implemented during the Inter High. It also has a lot of emotions and we can feel the empathy that is put in the characters even if I didn't felt much as the series pass

Other thing that I liked and surprised me were the characters. Most of the characters were like so weird, something I've never seen before. The designs were kind of original which made me have also an interest in watching it. They don't behave very much like we humans do: for example, there is this eyelashes guy called Izumida who is always saying: ABU ABU while he is cyclying. That isn't a very well common human behaviour.  But what I most liked was Midousuji's character....It has a lot of mystery, feeling and even if he is a creepy monster (believe me he is, he has a lot of unrealistic acts and can get really scary) we can see that he is a individual who has emotions and wants to win so bad for his own satisfaction (Yes, he is very individualist) because that's what makes him feel happy. It's a very deep character and I love characters that has like a mystery around them as I want to figure more things about them as the anime goes by. But I have to admit that I've never seen a character like Midousuji before he is the most weird of all but at the same time I can see what he has been trought and I can understand him as well.


But even if it has its things that I liked a lot there are things which I didn't liked. For example, the FLASHBACKS. This anime makes an abuse of constant flashbacks. A flashback can be nice when you want to know the character's childhood and why he is like that now. It's cool that every character has a flashback but there were times which they were very heavy. But I have to admit that the flashbacks in the first season weren't like the second season, which the last one I mentioned was very bad aranged and they repeated lots of flashbacks from the first season.

Other thing which was very irritating was the time of the race. For example, we have to wait like 10 chapters in 500 meters for the characters to arrive. Unfortunately, this gets worse as the Inter High is about to finish.


So overwall, the first season of Yowamushi Pedal is very good. It may be a little boring for you at the beggining but when the Inter High starts you'll want to watch all the rest of the episodes. I have to say that is not a typical sports anime for me and I enjoyed this season a lot. The Inter High doesn't finish here so you may have to watch the following season which is worst as I said before but at least it does brings you more information about Midousuji's character. 


And now that I think about it, maybe the anime doesn't deserve an 8 but I can't be objetive with it.  I love Yowamushi Pedal and I can rewatch it a lot of times and never get tired of it. Thinking about it, we all have this anime which may not be the best for a lot of people but we love it anyways, that's how individual tastes are in my opinion.

i am a big fan of sports anime, so im always looking for one, then i found yowamushi pedal. the first episode really took me away, it was really cool and made me say " this anime's really interesting!" 
STORY-10 
it follows the usual shounen-sports routine where a seemingly ordinary hs boy was introduced to a particular sport (in here it's biking) which he knows little about. he eventually starts enjoying the sport, becoming dedicated and meeting lots cool people (interesting characters). it has a nice-warm atmosphere which is common in shounen animes.
even though it follows the routine, yowamushi pedal has its own uniqueness makingit different and more exciting from other sports anime. There is never a boring part and it'll always wanna make you crave for the next episode.


ART-7

for me the art was just good, since i saw better art in other sports anime like Kuroko no Basket. It was colorful and i like the character designs but it can still get better, it's maybe the own art-style of the mangaka. The animation itself is good since it wont satisfy a sport anime fan like me if the animation is sloppy, right?


SOUND-10

the sounds used are perfect for the specific situations in the anime. It made me even more interested and eager to watch, making every scenes more exciting.  Especially the opening and ending songs, they were really cool, i've downloaded and keep on listening to them. 


CHARACTER-10

i like the characters, especially the main, Onoda, there's always something new to him and you know that he's gonna do something but you can never know how he'll do it. It always made me cheer "Zoom past all of them!". Even though he's shy and doesn't know anything, he's very determined and has a knack for the sport. you can also see his steady character development how he, slowly but surely gets stronger and continue to amaze the people around him. 


The sohoku bicycle team guys are cool too, especially makishima, i dont know why i lke him so much, there's a certain charm about him. I kinda like Naruko too, he somehow reminded me of Natsu of Fairy tail (i love Natsu) and then imaizumi kinda reminded me of Sasuke (i like sasuke too).Then, there's Manami, he looks so cute and cool to me, it made me cheer for hakogako though they're enemy team.


The characters are well introduced and you can see the character development on each of them. you can also see their past history.



ENJOYMENT-10

i really really enjoyed this anime to the point that i've watched this 3 times already and im stiil planning to watch it once more! even though i already knew what was going to happen since im updated in the manga, i still wanna see it in motion. this anime also made me wanna learn how to bike, and i can bike now, but i cant apply their techniques, im a beginner and it seems dangerous. It made me realize the joy of biking and the joy of being one wiht nature


OVERALL-10

it is really exciting and i highly recommend it! especially to sports anime fans out there this is a must watch and to those who just wanna have fun, it is definitely worth your time and i bet it'll make you into a sports-anime fan!

Warning: You are about to read a long review because there is so much to say about this extraordinary anime. 
Story = 10: Geez oh peez, from the get go this anime grabs the viewer's attention with a refreshing and unique start. The MC, Sakamichi Onada, is a border line otaku who is completely inept at sports but somehow ends up joining his high school's Bicycle Club. What's different about Yowamushi Pedal is that unlike other shonen & sports anime the story is not centered on the MC but rather on the team as a whole. In fact, the MC is not even the mostimportant character nor is he the strongest member of his team. However, Onada's personal development is particularly enjoyable to watch because he had such a humble beginning. Moreover, unlike the majority of MC's in sports anime, Onada remains comparatively weak until the end and loses many of his battles. But he is able to use his fierce passion for biking to overcome obstacles and beat strong opponents with a bit of help and support from his teammates. "If you can't overcome the obstacle in front of you, there is no future." Lastly, another interesting feature of the story line is that the Inter High tournament for cycling is three days long. Anything can happen within that time span and unexpected battles occur during every stage of this competition. 


Art = 9: When I first saw the MAL profile photo for Yowamushi Pedal I was turned off by the childish/cartoonish art style which is why I've put this anime on hold for so long. But upon starting the series I've come to realize how exceptional the art is. Incredible care and attention has been put into drawing the characters so that no two look the same and each has their unique features. From the dorky glasses and the pathetic maroon tracker's pants that Onada wears when cycling, to Makashima's ridiculously long green hair (which is totally unsuitable for biking at high speeds), and that one buff guy with girly eyelashes who named his pecs Andy and Frank, Watanabe Wataru has truly outdone himself in creating quirky, one-of-a-kind characters. Although some may criticize this anime's aesthetics, I personally believe that art is magnificent if it is able to leave an impression rather than merely fascinate viewers. I've watched many beautiful anime and have seen many more characters with stunning visuals, but few were memorable. Although none of the characters in Yowamushi Pedal are attractive, many are unforgettable because of their creative and unusual characteristics. 


Characters = 10: In my opinion the characters are the most important component of an anime. Many of the characters in Yowamushi Pedal are a breath of fresh air. For starters, Onada is not your typical MC. The writer couldn't have come up with a character who is more unlikely to become a bad-ass cyclist. Onada is a clumsy and pathetic guy whose obsession with anime is quite hilarious and endearing at the same time. As the story progresses Onada develops a fierce passion for road racing and his weak/pathetic nature is forgotten as he learns to face challenges and gradually overcome his limits. Prior to watching Yowamushi Pedal I've never really liked any of the MC's but Onada took me by surprise, and before I knew it this shy, hardworking otaku had taken a permanent spot in my heart. My favorite character in this anime, however, is Yuusuke Makishima. I love eccentric characters and there is nothing ordinary/normal about Makishima. His appearance is highly unusual (i.e. Makishima looks like a drag queen with his long, lush green hair and his disturbing moles) and he has this weird but wicked cycling technique called "Peak Spider." Not only that, Makishima comes off as a creep due to his awkward and unsociable personality. However appearances aren't everything and the viewers will soon adore the person Makishima is within. 


Enjoyment = 10: One of the main reasons why I gave Yowamushi Pedal a nearly perfect score was because of the director's ability to keep me watching until the end. It should be noted that most shonen/sports anime have a predictable plot which inevitably end ups becoming repetitive and boring to watch towards the middle or end of of the series. In addition, anime of the shonen genre have an annoying tendency to introduce ridiculous deus ex machina plot twists to superpower its MC and allow him/her to overcome insurmountable obstacles, which takes away from the overall enjoyment. However, Yowamushi Pedal avoids these (traps) by keeping the viewer continuously delighted and entertained throughout the series without having to introduce never before seen powers. This anime's pacing was marvelously executed and it effectively incorporated creative plot twists. There was never a dull moment in Yowamushi Pedal; in fact this will be the third time I've completed an anime from start to finish without skipping any episodes. I thought Haikyuu! would forever be my all-time favorite sports anime but Yowamushi Pedal has now taken the #1 spot.

Story 10: Yowamushi Pedal is a sport anime. Generally speaking, this is not my type because the genre I usually watch is either mystery or action. But because of my curiosity of this anime, I give a shot for this. This is a cycling-based sport anime and I thought it is a boring one because it is just about pedaling a bicycle but this anime exceeds my expectation. The story is about an otaku first year student who wants to join anime club  however the anime club in that school was abolished due of lack of members. As the story goes, he met somepeople who help him polished his hidden potential which is cycling. As I continue watching this, the intensity I feel is rising every episode. A lot of intense episodes which drawn me into its world. I feel like  I am one of those spectators. Overall, the story itself is very good and well-written also a lot of lessons about sportsmanship and friendship can be learned from this anime.


Art and Sound 10: The art and sound of this anime is also good because it feels realistic. 


Character 10: Characters in this anime are all well-developed. They are very hilarious and they are very funny in the after credit scene. I'm glad that they made a short scene after credits because that can ease the intensity of every episode. On the other hand, aside from the main characters, the other characters are consistent throughout the series. The main characters are developing every episode and they are too good. The timing for developing the potential of each main character are well done. 


Overall 10: Only two words that I can say to this series. "INTENSE" and "RIDICULOUS".

I love watching sports anime and I can't believe I missed this!! Just recently watched it still in ep 12 though..and really enjoying this show. To think that simple things you do everyday may become one of your talents and that's how this show was.. Onoda who is bad at P.E is now capable of being in the cycling road race because of his eagerness to save money and rather bike 90 km than ride a train just to buy his favorite capsule toy. 
 I also love the other characters because it was unusual how they treat him, I thought they would look downon him but instead they give him help and courage that he can do it. \n\n
